To the chief Musician upon Gittith, <FI>A Psalm<Fi> of Asaph. Sing aloud unto God our strength: make a joyful noise unto the God of Jacob.<RF>of Asaph: or, for Asaph<Rf>
Take a psalm, and bring hither the timbrel, the pleasant harp with the psaltery.
Blow up the trumpet in the new moon, in the time appointed, on our solemn feast day.
For this <FI>was<Fi> a statute for Israel, <FI>and<Fi> a law of the God of Jacob.
This he ordained in Joseph <FI>for<Fi> a testimony, when he went out through the land of Egypt: <FI>where<Fi> I heard a language <FI>that<Fi> I understood not.<RF>through: or, against<Rf>
I removed his shoulder from the burden: his hands were delivered from the pots.<RF>were…: Heb. passed away<Rf>
Thou calledst in trouble, and I delivered thee; I answered thee in the secret place of thunder: I proved thee at the waters of Meribah. Selah.<RF>Meribah: or, Strife<Rf><CM>
Hear, O my people, and I will testify unto thee: O Israel, if thou wilt hearken unto me;
There shall no strange god be in thee; neither shalt thou worship any strange god.
I <FI>am<Fi> the LORD thy God, which brought thee out of the land of Egypt: open thy mouth wide, and I will fill it.
But my people would not hearken to my voice; and Israel would none of me.
So I gave them up unto their own hearts' lust: <FI>and<Fi> they walked in their own counsels.<RF>unto…: or, to the hardness of their hearts, or, imagination<Rf>
Oh that my people had hearkened unto me, <FI>and<Fi> Israel had walked in my ways!
I should soon have subdued their enemies, and turned my hand against their adversaries.
The haters of the LORD should have submitted themselves unto him: but their time should have endured for ever.<RF>submitted…: or, yielded feigned obedience: Heb. lied<Rf>
He should have fed them also with the finest of the wheat: and with honey out of the rock should I have satisfied thee.<RF>finest…: Heb. fat of wheat<Rf><CM>
